bibl.title: Ng Kwack Kang v. King County. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p:
In the United States District Court, In and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the application of NG KWACK KANG, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
No. 3157 Writ of Habeas Corpus.
The President of the United States of America, to United States Commissioner of Immigration, HENRY M. WHITE:
We command you that you have the body of NG KWACK KANG, by you imprisoned and detained under Order of Deportation, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention and order of deportation by whatsoever name the said NG KWACK KANG, shall be named or charged. before Honorable JEREMIAH NETERER. Judge of the Unites States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the Federal Building, in Seattle, State of Washington, on the 15th day of November, 1915, at Two o'clock P.M. of that date, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said NG KWACK KANG, and have you then and there the body of the said NG KWACK KANG and there this Writ.
WITNESS: The Honorable Jeremiah Neterer Judge of the United States District Court, Western Distict of Washington, Northern Division, ad the Federal Building, Seattle, Washington, this 11th day of November 1915.
ATTEST; my hand and seal of the United States District Court, the day and year last above written.
Frank L. Crossby Clerk By EML Deputy Clerk.

3157 Original In the U.S. SuperiorDistrict Court State of Washington King County
In and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division
Plaintiff Vs. In the Matter of the application of NG KWACK Kang, for a Writ of habeas corpus. Defendant Writ of Habeas Corpus
Beeler and Sullivan Lawyers 510-11 White Building Seattle, Wash.
Filed in the U.S. District Court Western District of Washington, Northern Division Nov 13, 1915 Frank L/ Crosby, Clerk, By EML Deputy
